title: Add PDF support with page extraction to read tool
description:
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** to read PDF documents with page markers
**So that** AI can access documentation, research papers, and PDF-based resources

**Context:**
Many codebases include PDF documentation, design specs, and research papers. The read tool should extract text from PDFs with clear page boundaries. Research shows:
- Claude Code Read tool supports PDFs with visual presentation
- MCP servers use MIME detection and handle PDFs specially
- Page markers help AI understand document structure
- Not all PDFs have extractable text (scanned PDFs)

**Technical Notes:**
- Add PDF support to src/consoul/ai/tools/implementations/read.py
- Use PyPDF2 or pdfplumber (add as optional dependency)
- Detect .pdf extension to trigger PDF handling
- Insert page markers: "=== Page N ==="
- Support start_page/end_page parameters (like offset/limit for text)
- Add to pyproject.toml [tool.poetry.group.pdf.dependencies] (optional group)
- Respect config.enable_pdf and config.pdf_max_pages

**Research References:**
- PyPDF2 docs: https://pypdf2.readthedocs.io/en/3.x/user/extract-text.html
- Example from ChatGPT research: for i, page in enumerate(reader.pages, start=1)
- MCP server approach: Check file size, return references for large files

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** a PDF file with extractable text
**When** read_file(file_path="docs/design.pdf") is called
**Then** text is extracted with "=== Page N ===" markers between pages

**Given** a PDF with start_page=5, end_page=7
**When** read_file is called with page range
**Then** only pages 5-7 are extracted and returned

**Given** a scanned PDF with no extractable text
**When** read_file is called
**Then** returns "[PDF contains no extractable text or is scanned]"

**Given** enable_pdf=False in config
**When** attempting to read a PDF
**Then** returns "PDF reading is disabled in configuration"

**Given** a PDF with 100 pages and pdf_max_pages=50
**When** reading without page range
**Then** only first 50 pages are read with truncation message

**Testing Considerations:**
- Create test PDFs with known content
- Test with PyPDF2 and pdfplumber (choose one)
- Test page range parameters
- Test scanned PDFs (no text)
- Test max pages limit
- Test PDF detection by extension
- Mock PDF reading for unit tests

**Implementation Hints:**
```python
def _read_pdf(path: Path, start_page: int | None, end_page: int | None, config: ReadToolConfig) -> str:
    if not config.enable_pdf:
        return "PDF reading is disabled"
    
    from PyPDF2 import PdfReader  # or pdfplumber
    reader = PdfReader(path)
    
    start = start_page or 1
    end = min(end_page or len(reader.pages), config.pdf_max_pages)
    
    text = ""
    for i in range(start-1, end):
        page = reader.pages[i]
        text += f"=== Page {i+1} ===\\n"
        text += page.extract_text() or "[No text on this page]"
        text += "\\n"
    
    return text
```
- Add ReadFileInput fields: start_page, end_page
- Check Path.suffix == ".pdf" to trigger PDF mode
- Handle PyPDF2 exceptions gracefully
- Optional dependency in pyproject.toml

comments.content: PACKAGING NOTE: This ticket requires adding PyPDF2 or pdfplumber as an OPTIONAL dependency group in pyproject.toml. Create [tool.poetry.group.pdf] with the chosen library. The read tool should gracefully handle missing PDF libraries and return a helpful error message if enable_pdf=true but the library isn't installed. Dependencies: SOUL-79 (config must define enable_pdf, pdf_max_pages), SOUL-80 (core read infrastructure must exist).
